events.title: John Glenn Orbits Earth
events.description: John Glenn becomes the first American astronaut to orbit the Earth aboard Friendship 7 during NASA's Mercury-Atlas 6 mission.
events.significance: This event marked a major milestone in the United States' space program during the Space Race, boosting national pride and advancing human spaceflight.

events.title: United States Postal Service Established
events.description: The United States government establishes the United States Post Office Department (now USPS).
events.significance: The creation of an organized postal service significantly improved communication across the young nation and laid the foundation for the modern postal system.

events.description: The Victoria Bridge, the first bridge to span the St. Lawrence River, officially opens, connecting Montreal and the South Shore in Canada.
events.significance: It was one of the longest bridges in the world at the time and played a crucial role in developing Canada's railway network and economy.

events.title: Battle of the Kasserine Pass Begins
events.description: First major battle between American and Axis forces in World War II's North African campaign begins.
events.significance: Though initially a setback for American forces, the battle provided valuable combat experience that helped improve their effectiveness in subsequent campaigns.
